private_information: I hold four disks labeled A (smallest), B, C, D (largest) stacked top to bottom as A, B, C, D
left_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg in correct order so the final stack on right is A, B, C, D top to bottom

middle_peg.goal: Provide an intermediate location as needed to help transfer disks to the right peg without violating stacking rules

right_peg.goal: Receive the entire stack of disks in correct order, top to bottom A, B, C, D

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg states and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: Three pegs are available named left, middle, and right.
Disks are labeled A, B, C, D from smallest (A) to largest (D).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D.

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg. State your current stack of disks exactly and list any local constraints or observations about moves you can make. Provide factual concise output only.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. The environment public information is {environment->public_information}. Your private information is {agents->left_peg->private_information}. Your local goal is {agents->left_peg->goal}. Produce a short factual description of your current state and any constraints relevant to moving disks from your peg. Do not produce PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the middle peg. State your current stack of disks exactly and list any local constraints or observations about moves you can make. Provide factual concise output only.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. The environment public information is {environment->public_information}. Your private information is {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. Your local goal is {agents->middle_peg->goal}. Produce a short factual description of your current state and any constraints relevant to moving disks from your peg. Do not produce PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the right peg. State your current stack of disks exactly and list any local constraints or observations about moves you can make. Provide factual concise output only.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. The environment public information is {environment->public_information}. Your private information is {agents->right_peg->private_information}. Your local goal is {agents->right_peg->goal}. Produce a short factual description of your current state and any constraints relevant to moving disks from your peg. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at producing PDDL domains and problems targeted to the FastDownward planner. Your job is to generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the peg state reports. The PDDL should be compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use clear object names for pegs and disks and define move actions between pegs that enforce the single-move and size ordering constraints.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the peg state descriptions: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right}. The public rules to follow are {environment->public_information}. Your goal is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the peg reports and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that, when solved by FastDownward, achieves the goal of moving the full stack from left to right with legal moves only. Keep actions generic and respectful of disk size ordering. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
